text:
(1)
Clasons Point Amusement Park (Bronx): The entrance to the park's swimming pool on the west side of Soundview Avenue, between Pugsley and Husson Avenues. The amusement center was later abandoned.

July 29, 1928
P.L. Sperr

(2)
A general view of the bathing area.

July 29, 1928
P.L. Sperr

(3)
The roller coaster within the park. On the extreme right appears part of the dancing palace.

July 29, 1928
P.L. Sperr

(1) Pugsley's Creek, Bronx: A view northeastward across the mouth of the creek from the foot of Cornell Ave. In the center background is Screvin's Point, on the other side of which is Westchester Creek.

P. L. Sperr.
July 29, 1928.

(2) At the mouth of the Creek as viewed directly eastward from the same vantage point. In the background is Old Ferry Point on which is located the House of the Good Shepherd.

P. L. Sperr.
July 29, 1928.
title: Pugsley Creek - Bronx - Cornell Avenue - [House of The Good Shepherd.]

(1)
Soundview Avenue, east side, between Pugsley and Husson Avenues, showing Kane's Casino.

July 29, 1928
P. L. Sperr

(2)

August 5, 1935
